reviewText: Hallmark Hall of Fame's sensitive exploration of friendship, racism and the impact of war on its survivors, DECORATION DAY is set in Georgia. Adapted from the John Corrington novella.SYNOPSIS--A retired judge (Garner) mourns his wife's death by withdrawing from the world to spend all his time fishing. When childhood friend Gee Pennywell (Cobb) refuses to accept a belated Congressional Medal of Honor for actions at the Battle of the Bulge, Judge Finch intervenes. Finch thus comes out of his "shell" but he must also confront his long-ago betrayal of the bitterly estranged Pennywell."Decoration Day" is available in limited quantities onDVD.Also recommended:Hallmark Hall of Fame's BREATHING LESSONS (1994) stars James Garner and Joanne Woodward as a married couple who discuss their lives and relationship while on a road trip. reviewText: This film stars Bill Cobbs as a war hero who refuses the Congressional medal of honor, and James Garner as a retired judge and Cobbs' childhood friend. As the years go by, their lives take decidedly different roads. However, their friendship is rekindled when an unexpected visitor comes to town, forcing Cobbs to deal with some ghosts from his military service and the two of them to revisit some long forgotten childhood memories. This is an excellent movie with a lot of heart. Ruby Dee also turns in a stellar performance.

reviewText: Much has been written about this affecting made-for-TV movie based on John William Corrington's novella. However, "Decoration Day" (1990) serves as a testament to the understated brilliance of James Garner. The veteran actor delivers an exemplary performance as a reclusive retired judge - with strong support from Judith Ivey, Bill Cobbs, Laurence Fishburne and Emmy winner Ruby Dee. Unpretentiously directed by Robert Markowitz, who never lets the drama lapse into Hallmark sentiment. Ideal viewing for Memorial Day.
